questionsData.title: Water has two states of matter.
Corrode and eat away are synonyms.
A cat is covered in feathers.
questionsData.explain_answer: "A cat is covered in feathers" is incorrect because cats are not naturally covered in feathers. Cats have fur, which differs from feathers in terms of texture, structure, and composition. Feathers are characteristic of birds and certain other species, while fur is the typical covering for mammals such as cats.

questionsData.title: Square, curved and round are examples of shapes.
To crossbreed animal" means" making new ones".
A peak is the highest part of a mountain .
Vibration is the source of the sound.
The crust is the soft rock surface of the earth.
It is difficult to control a forest fire.
Nightmares are brilliant dreams.
"Homeless" means" having new home".
A weak form of the disease leads to immunity.
School leaver is somebody in his first year.
The design of a text is a layout.
A person who applies for a job is an applicant.
A suffix changes the word into a different part of speech.
Things you use in cooking are ingredients.
You have to squeeze lemon before you drink it.
The sun is closer to the earth than the moon.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The moon is much closer to Earth than the sun. In fact, the sun is an enormous distance away compared to the moon.

  • The moon is approximately 238,855 miles (384,400 kilometers) from Earth.
  • The sun is a staggering 93 million miles (149.6 million kilometers) from Earth.

questionsData.title: The cabin is a small house in which you live.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Cabin (ship) a small, enclosed room on a ship used for passengers or crew.
May have beds, furniture, and storage space.
Not a permanent residence, but provides living quarters for a journey.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about…….
questionsData.article: Air is a mixture of invisible gases, mainly oxygen and nitrogen, that surrounds Earth, It is about one-fifth oxygen and four nitrogen, There are small amounts of water vapor and carbon dioxide in the air. These gases make up less than one percent of air, air has a lot of power, it takes up space, On the surface of Earth, we are at the bottom of a layer of air. The weight of air pushing own on Earth's surface helps create air pressure, When there is less air around you, less pressure is felt, This is a low-pressure area, Cold air helps create high-pressure areas. It is also a big factor in wind and weather, When there is a difference in air reassure, air is moved, The movement of air is wind, Air pressure and wind affect the weather. Storms develop when there are rapid changes in temperature and air pressure, Hurricanes, thunderstorms, and gentle breezes are all caused by wind and changes air pressure. Air is odorless; we can't smell it. It is also tasteless and invisible Without air, people and other living organism couldn't survive, Air allows plants and animals to exchange the oxygen and carbon dioxide that all living things need to survive.

questionsData.title: The engineers plan to build ….. new university
A hill is …. than a mountain .
Samia loves food……, she can't cook.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Samia loves food However, she can't cook.

"However" is the best choice because it introduces a contrast or opposition between two ideas. In this case, the two ideas are:

  1. Samia loves food.
  2. Samia can't cook.

 

"However مع ذلك" هو الخيار الأفضل لأنه يقدم تباينًا أو تعارضًا بين فكرتين. وفي هذه الحالة الفكرتان هما:

1- سامية تحب الطعام.

2- سامية لا تستطيع الطبخ.

questionsData.title: The two words sounds the same, but they're spelled….
I watched the birds ……away then I checked the cage.
questionsData.explain_answer:
I watched the birds flying away then I checked the cage.

 

  • "Watched" is in the past tense, indicating a completed action.
  • "Flying" is a present participle. because the action of flying is happening at the same time as you're watching them.

I need his help. The word "help" is a/an …..
Which of these words is a compound?
To change the word " trust " into another noun, we add the suffix ….
Have the teacher …… you .
questionsData.explain_answer:
Use of have/get + infinitive

You use these verbs to replace other instruction words such as ask, tell or order.

Example:

Ask the boy to put away his bag.
→    Have the boy put away his bag.
→    Get the boy to put away his bag.
Note: With have, the infinitive is without to.

questionsData.title: He ….. be Zaid Ali . Zaid Ali is dead.
If I …. you , I'd study English.
